meanings.definition: A person who writes or performs farces.
meanings.sent1: The talented farceur had the audience laughing throughout the play.
meanings.sent2: The farceur's comedic timing was impeccable in the hilarious skit.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous farceur decided to add a funny twist to the script.
meanings.sent4: The clever farceur turned everyday situations into comedic gold.
meanings.sent5: The aspiring farceur studied the art of comedy to perfect their craft.

meanings.sent1: The playful farceur loved to pull pranks on their friends.
meanings.sent2: The mischievous farceur always had a trick up their sleeve.
meanings.sent3: The little farceur thought it would be funny to hide their sibling's toy.
meanings.sent4: The neighborhood farceur was known for their hilarious practical jokes.
meanings.sent5: The class clown was considered the ultimate farceur among the students.
